Her dark hair in a tight bun, no makeup-- she’s tanned an toned, the result of fife in her surroundings. Her eyes l above, into the treeline, as she loads her tool belt into TRUCK, “...did I hear something?” REMINGTON RIFLE strapped on her back, her hand moves to t 9MM on her hip-- she turns down the CLASSICAL MUSIC playi from the dash... and listens-- nothing but nature. She loads up to go, with a smile, she stares up to the ne restored sign:

dialogues.speaker: TO

It shifts limbs, to follow her, as she drives on-- passin the quaint CABINS and a MAIN HALL giving way to a large FIELD, a LAKE in the distance. Her TRUCK disappears under the foliage, into the spider w of PATHS cut out of the wild to make up the Merrymaker Campgrounds. As the sun fades, a CLAW grips a branch, bits of FLESH an BLOOD cover it-- the monster growls us to...

Her dark hair plain, same as her clothes and makeup, a sacrifice made by a stay at home mom. WATER BOT and SNACKS in one hand, KEYS, PURSE, MAIL in the other... atop her SIX MONTH PREGNANT BELLY. dialogues.speaker: ROLAND

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINE
dialogues.text: Oray 4 okay--_ Daddy's gotta go-- (taking her from him) --go wash for dinner, please, Iz? Two squirts of soap only.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: --hey, we do what mommy asks, please. (creeping toward Tzzy) ++-0r... daddy will sneak in your room. .-. while you're sleeping... and-- Ro tickles her tummy again-- setting off a squealing fit. stops, kisses her, Sending her on her way:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. See you in the morning, Bumble Butt. After she’s gone: ROLAND (CONT’D) You know what I think is sexy? You braving the Attic of Death for--

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINE
dialogues.text: --what’s not sexy is my butt hurting from driving around all day, looking for that stupid thing. I’m tired, I’m behind on my deadline now--

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINE

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINE, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m almost there-- I had a breakthrough, but I don’t think I like the ending.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Yeah... but what if the monster has to live, with you? Ah well, I’11 figure it out... see you tonight.  A kiss on her cheek as he goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dim COLLEGE LECTURE HALL. KARA (25) a_cute blonde, finishes giving her report in fr of the CLASS. She wears a PHANTOM OF THE OPERA SK, makeup done up on it. Blown up behind her, a PHOTO of Kara and h TEST SUBJECT, a more hideous version, her makeup Joker-li

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: ..-my test patient’s charade of misconstrued feelings, will lead to misguided intentions. Therefore, no matter how she chooses to doll wu now, this will manifest one day in her actions. The makeup is merely her mask covering the scars none of us can gee: ) ipping a page .--but my issue Pont with her feelings, or even her way of thinking. What choice did she have? She's labeled a “freak”, triggering ears of oppressing her true eelings-- loneliness, inadequacy-- the inability to live “up to the standard”. A standard set by whom? Daddy didn’t give affection. Mommy didn’t care. So who’s left? The rest of the class-- 15 STUDENTS, all wear masks-- ali funny, scary, a catcher’s mask, homemade, all kinds:

dialogues.speaker: KARA, (CONT'D)

(then) If we don’t begin to recognize and help these types of people, before it reaches a point where maniacal thoughts become actions, you might never know when Your worst nightmare could be sitting right next to you. (then) Thank you. The lights come UP e the class claps. Roland sits anonymo amongst them, in his wolf mask. As the kids remove masks:

dialogues.text: Kinda exhilarating, isn’t it? That feeling you get behind the mask... a strange freedom, right? An anonymity-- with the power to do almost anything you want. (he_ stands) Powerful imagery, Kara. Very creative. (she smiles) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My one criticism, if you can even call it that-- what to do about the people who love their masks? Those who refuse to take it off, ever? Are they worth the time, money and resources? As he makes his way through the row, mask still on:

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: The problem is our foundation, built on ‘We the People’, was trampled over by the “Dime, Money and Resources People”, who gonveniently are never available when--

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND

dialogues.speaker: KARA

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Can we get some poll numbers on that?

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: --or hell, who knows, maybe my test patient iS an evil genius, plotting to murder me during our follow up session and Chaos Theory wins again! The class bursts laughter-- Roland too-- Kara’s eyes ling on Roland, as he approaches the podium. He pulls off his mask, whispering something to her, it makes her smile. He moves her aside, reaching down, to a small CAULDRON be Holding it up:

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND

dialogues.speaker: TREAT, SALTY OR SWEET
dialogues.text: She reaches up, her eyes on him, as she pulls a RED LOLLI

(waving) Make good choices this weekend, my pet brains. The class murmurs, shuffling out-- Roland begins to gathe his things-- after a moment:

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND

dialogues.text: I was thinking of basing a book on my test patient from my thesis. A story based on her fucked up story..? She pops her sucker out, biting her lip--

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: ...uh huh. (a charged beat, then) Okay look, I think there are some things to consider before we jump into this. (MORE )

dialogues.text: We all have voices in our heads, but sometimes it gets hard to hear which one is speaking the loudest and if its message is most important, you understand? (she_ nods) Let’s talk more next week.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: +.-um, no.

dialogues.text: --hey, it’s “water under the bridge” now. No skin off our backs... No harm, no foul.

dialogues.speaker: KARA
dialogues.text: “No harm, no foul”, I like that. then) That reminds me-- check your e-mail before you get home.

Bishop, you would not recognize me, but more my family, owners of the Merrymaker Campgrounds-- undoubtebly made famous by your book... He trails off, Christine watching him closely. When final

dialogues.text: Roland--

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND

(he reacts) I'd love to just run off from life, from my work, from everything when it isn’t perfect... but one of us has to be the adult. We both know who drew that card. dialogues.speaker: ROLAND

What happened’ to those two young girls was a tragedy, and should be viewed and treated as such, in my opinion. If you_believe that book, you must also believe animals are gonna rise outta the cemetery too?

dialogues.text: (noticing him) You seem-- disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: THE REPORTER
dialogues.text: I was actually hoping you'd say the bigfoot sighting reported on AmigosDelSquatche.org...

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: The what?

dialogues.speaker: THE REPORTER
dialogues.text: It'sa circulating Monthly Squatch Report-- Sir Squatch, reportedly surfaced .67 miles from this exact location. You haven’t seen any traces?

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: Unfortunately not.

dialogues.speaker: THE REPORTER
dialogues.text: But Burl--

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: --I don’t know what Burl was thinking, but his way of thinking is the reason he’s no longer here. As she steps past him: ANITA (CONT’D) --so, how ‘bout the quick tour on your way out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anita and the reporter walk, the only light her FLASHLIGH

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: -..-this is off the record? He pockets his RECORDER, then: ANITA (CONT’D The truth is when the ound those two girls, only m mother, brother and step dad, Burl, were here.

dialogues.speaker: THE REPORTER
dialogues.text: Can I talk to mom or brother?

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: My brother Wayne turned eighteen, checked out that summer after it all happened-- I haven’t talked to him since. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: ANITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Our real dad split, cause he couldn’t deal with my crazy, over- bearing mother, leaving her here alone to run this place. She stumbled upon the meat sack known as Burl, and married the oaf. But when she died last year, half cancer, half broken heart-- Burl was asked to leave, so... I’m sorry, I don’t look like a buck- tooth, in-bred, who likes to blend babies into smoothies, but--

dialogues.speaker: SCALPING EXPERT.
dialogues.text: She smiles wicked--

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: You’1l never know. The BEAST waits silently, hunched low, undetected in the brush-- its dark eyes anonymously fixed on the lanky trespasser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A simple clinic-- a few tables, some beds and cabinets fu of the usual medical supplies. Poppy pulls Lupita’s shirt off, some DRIED BLOOD and CUTS. Lupita shakes, still in s of what she’s seen. Poppy tenderly cares for her wounds-- Lupita reflexes:

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: You're safe. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: LUPITA
dialogues.text: Not safe here. (then) ...safe in the desert, with no monster. POPPY eyes her, eyeing her shirt, Amigos Del Squatche acr it, holding it up:

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: You’ve run a long way from home...

dialogues.speaker: LUPITA
dialogues.text: I no want to go-- but I did, then on my camera, you see it, I see it! On there, this is the monster, I record it! It kills--  16 19.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: --okay, I’ll get you your camera, but just relax for a minute, okay? Let me at least get you cleaned up. Lupita shrinks, as Poppy bandages a cut, moving to anothe

dialogues.speaker: POPPY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...I believe you.

dialogues.speaker: LUPITA
dialogues.text: Insides parts-- guts-- they fall on my head-- Lupita breaks down, Poppy tries to comfort her, reaching to wipe her tears. Her touch is intimate:

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Hey, no one is gonna hurt you okay You have nothing to be afraid (beat) --if you weren’t safe, I'd drive you out to the desert myself.

dialogues.speaker: LUPITA
dialogues.text: You will drive me..? Esta Noche? Poppy’s stare lingers on her, then gives her TWO WHITE PI and a cup of water.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Let’s see how you feel after you take these... Like a frightened animal, Lupita takes them--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hidden within the thick trees, the BEAST paces Anita and Reporter, mixing in with his surroundings:

dialogues.speaker: THE REPORTER
dialogues.text: ..-what about the camera, left with the two teena' e girls, maimed at the lake? No e was found with the bodies? At east, that’s what the police reports say. That what you say?

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: Unfortunately our time is up.

dialogues.speaker: THE REPORTER
dialogues.text: Ok, but one last thing! You look armed for World War Z-- nets, trang guns, shotguns... what’s out here got you so scared, Ranger Rambo?  17 20. As the pair approach the main gate:

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: My God, you're a perfect portrait of the world. Obsessed with death, till it knocks on your front door: She pulls her 9MM from her hip-- ANITA (CONT’D I‘1l make you famous, if you like?

dialogues.speaker: THE REPORTER
dialogues.text: No, no, I'm--

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: --I'm sorry our camp has no man- eating inbreeds, no bigfoots, no noghing but real folks getting ready for it’s re-opening. She aims her gun at the NO TRESPASSING SIGN hung on the g ANITA (CONT’D) No means no, even in the middle of nowhere. A low GRUMBLE as the BEAST moves among the limbs--, she unlocks it, ushering him out... immediately locking up be him. ANITA (CONT’D) Well, Godspeed. And with her light, she turns to go-- leaving him in the pitch black, his only hope the moonlight... as she retrea e lingers, then reluctantly starts back to his car. He shuffles down the road, out of site-- then pops back o

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: I'd be doing a great disservice to my audience if I didn’t try to get an interview with that Mexican Girl. (then) And he said, “Let there be liiiight"! He pulls his PHONE from his pocket, his flashlight APP fl out in front of him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Within the trees, the BEAST follows the small GLOW made b the reporter-- tracking in silence.  19 21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Reporter sneaks up to the gate, gripping the metal, w a RUSTLE moves inside the gate. He pauses--

dialogues.speaker: THE REPORTER
dialogues.text: ...Ranger Bishop? Nothing... he stands frozen, then scoffs: THE REPORTER (CONT’D) Careful of your vagina on the way over, sir. He lifts his body up, scaling with no problem, plucks a f in, pushing up-- then another RUSTLE. SNAP! CRACK! He auses , suspended on the fence. He holds out his phone light, it’s little use. He climbs up, perching atop the fence, straddling it, scoping the area. He whips out his recorder: THE REPORTER (CONT’ Pp. Bigfootsafoot investi ation, og Log. The time is-- I don’t know what o'clock. I am at MerryMaker Camp Grounds. I am experiencing familiar, yet unidentifiable sounds- --a primal HOWL starts a chain of loon calls: THE REPORTER (CONT’D) This might be the very moment, tonight-- I make first, bonafide contact with the primordial. ~- Sir Squatch. I will now attempt to climb down off of the fence for further investigation. Log out. He swings a leg over, when HEAVY FOOTSTEPS approach-- cau him to pause-- it’s too dark to see anything. THE REPORTER (CONT’D) ...other Ranger Bishop, is that you? He tries to climb quietly, when suddenly something darts whipping past him: THE REPORTER (CONT’D) Little Mexican girl? Hola-- --but before his foot can hit the ground, his LEGS are ta out below him-- he flops, banging his head on the dirt, B spurting from his mout. Quickly, the reporter’s body is dragged off the main road with grunts, rustling, then a PIERCING SCREAM, the call o victory...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ro sits at his desk, his computer his only light. The let to Marilyn laid in his lap. He stares up to the MERRYMAKE MURDERER POSTER, lost in thought. Pulled up on screen, the Merrymaker Campground WEB SITE; focused on a picture of POPRY Poppy holds a POSTER SIGN, appearing to be naked behind it, “COME PLAY WHERE THE WIL THINGS ARE!” Roland’s broken from the moment, when the door pops open behind him-- it’s Izzy, wandered out of bed. She hold her BLACK TEDDY BEAR in hand. Flipping the screen off, he poc the letter, moving to her:

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: .--what’s up, little girl? You have another bad dream? Nodding, she raises her arms for him. He grabs her and he

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Daddy’s got you now, you’re safe. (re. the bear) Did Mommy get you a new teddy? I like this one, he’s cute...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roland stares down, chewing the end of his PEN. He stands looking at Christine, a red SLEEPING MASK over her eyes. Finally, it hits him what to write, he begins to scribble FADE OUT. INT. ROLAND’S HOUSE - BEDROOM - DAY 22 A kick from the baby wakes Christine. She rolls over, pul her mask off... Roland’s side of the bed made, with a NOT folded on his pillow. She opens it, reading... then tosse back onto the pillow, all it reads is: I moved some stuff around, everything is taken care of fo youl I love you, but I think I need this. It's about survival.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flat horizon of open highway, city in the rearview... down, hair blowing in the wind, Ro cruises. He cranks the radio, turning up the rock tune-- a cover version of PEAR JAM'S “Animal”.  24 25 28 23. INT. CAMPGROUNDS - ANITA’S CABIN - DAY 24 Anita stares at the monitor, watching shaky playback on Lupita’s camera... FOOTAGE: NIGHT VISION-- a LARGE CLIFF SIDE eroded out of mountain-- muttering voices overlap, when suddenly, emerg from a CREVASSE-- a LARGE, HAIRY FIGURE. The voices GASPS Then the SCREEN cuts to SHAKY RUNNING, from the opening

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: .«..ugh, enough of the shaky screen.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (through the radio) Hey, think I found somethin’ worth reporting, Annie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roland rolls his window down, holding the phone out, tryi for a signal. The radio hums on low static. Into his

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Hey, Hon-- I assume you’re enjoying your facial about now... I know-- I’m a stubborn ass, but this will be good for us. You know how I feel about my fans. And I’m outta your hair, now you can get some writing-- BEEP, BEEP, BEEP-- the call drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anita stands over the Reporter’s SHOES-- Poppy behind her chewing her nail:

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: Any other traces? Poppy hands Anita the Reporter’s KEYS and his broken iPho

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Those-- more big scat_next to big freakin’ footprints. It’s getting closer-- more curious. Anita follows the drag marks leading into the bushes, her eyes lift up into the trees:

dialogues.speaker: POPPY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lupita told me last night juts fell of a tree onto her hea  24.

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: --what!? No, that’s delirium, hallucinations, dehydration, malnutrition, sun exposure--

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: This has gotten way out out of control since he left!

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: --we don't need Burl! Do you understand me, Penelope! ? HONK, HONK! An old FORD CAMPER-BED TRUCK rolls up to the with a squeal-- eyeing the driver:

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Well, I called him because we do need him! I need him to eliminate a prenletg from my life. He might just e my ticket outta town. Poppy stares daggers, jutting her hand out for Anita’s KE

dialogues.speaker: POPPY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: .--I’m letting him in.

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: We’1ll discuss this later, Ms. Bishop. Reluctantly, she hands the keys off, and Poppy heads forw Idling with a smile, BURL WOLF (60) cigarette SMOKE billo out his nostrils-- his salt/pepper hair is cropped tight. looks the kind with a sordid past, horrors locked behind recessed eyes. A P.O.W. FLAG hangs in his BACK WINDOW, he’s already in h CAMO CHEF'S APRON. He rolls down his window, passing Popp he SALUTES-- his accent southern:

dialogues.speaker: BURL
dialogues.text: Well, well, Miss Tinker Belle. You look’ more like a fairy tale every time I see ya’. How’s it, Muffin?

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Spinning my wheels. Can I pop one those squares from you, daddio?

dialogues.speaker: BURL
dialogues.text: You should never smoke... He ejects a cigarette for her, she lips it, as he goes to light it:

dialogues.speaker: BURL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: .--alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (marching over) Ey, Future Lung Cancer Advocates-- She snaps the cigarette from Poppy's mouth, crumpling it. squeezes Poppy’s arm with a win

dialogues.speaker: BURL
dialogues.text: Nose to the ground, soldier. Anita looks into the truck bed: TWO LAUNDRY SACKS, full:

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: What did she tell you?

dialogues.speaker: BURL
dialogues.text: Clean up, Aisle One. I brought my whole bag of tricks with me. Little sister had me pick these up for you on the way in-- don’t worry, I didn’t peek. He hands her a PHOTO ENVELOPE--

dialogues.speaker: BURL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You missed me?

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: Like my period. (quick) A reporter. Said he talked specifically to you. How does that happen?

dialogues.speaker: BURL
dialogues.text: don’ the voice-mail code’f you don’t want me responding to guest inquiries. She throws the bloody shoe into his truck. Burl scoops it

dialogues.speaker: BURL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The poor sole.. Burl cackles, blurting out smoke. Poppy giggles. Anita sn

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: --ey, any cockameme ideas you brew up Yh that burnt out brain, dispose ‘em immediately and I will consider allowing you to stay here, you copy?

dialogues.speaker: BURL
dialogues.text: Ooooh-rah, ae? sizzle just like your mama did He exhales SMOKE out the sides of his crooked grin:  29 26.

dialogues.speaker: BURL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Any luck with the traps, Popsicle?

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: -.-it’s too smart for the traps. It did take the blouses-- but left the trap untouched.

dialogues.speaker: BURL
dialogues.text: Sounds like it’s playin’ with you. Burl grins, as he sucks down a drag:

dialogues.speaker: BURL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sounds like you two need the big, bad Wolf after all. Anita and Burl’s eyes meet, a tense moment lingers--

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: --should be a pot of boiling water waiting for you in the Mess hall. Welcome to the House Made of Brick. He salutes--—

dialogues.speaker: BURL
dialogues.text: Lighten up, Piggie-- or you'll never make it out alive. With a_ toot of the horn, and goes. On his bumper sticker GONE CRAZY-- WANNA COME ALONG? Then, from behind:

dialogues.speaker: LUPITA
dialogues.text: Dénde diablos esta mi cadmara!? Anita whips, Poppy too-- as Lupita limps up:

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: I thought you took care of this..?

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: This won't go without her belongings.

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: (low) It’s in my cabin. Take your 4x to get the rest of her things, I’1l go grab it and you can take my truck and get her out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is dense, cramped to every corner with old knic knacks and priced antiques-- rusted ANIMAL TRAPS hang beh Roland as he plops his WATER and JERKY onto the counter.  27. THE SHOP ATTENDANT is an odd looking man. He wears bottle glasses, a ZOMBIE SHIRT under FLANNEL and a JACKET/VEST f of incense, crystals and other mystical objects...

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Could you tell me if I’m going in the right direction? Guess my GPS must stands for Generic Pieca’ Shit. He chuckles, the attendant looks up.

dialogues.speaker: THE ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, did you say something?

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Well, what are the chances? Roland points to the cardboard shelf behind him, “Bargain Books”-- a few copies of MERRYMAKER MURDERER the only cop left on the shelf, each $2.99:

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s actually where I’m headed-- MerryMaker Campground. Do you know if it’s close to here?

dialogues.speaker: THE ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: It’s closed.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Yes, I know. That’s actually the very reason I’m headed there--

dialogues.speaker: THE ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: --why? You one of those freaks into having sex at murder sites? Cause that’s freaky. Out of balance. You don’t look like a freak, but those tend to be the freakiest freaks. Freaks who don’t look like freaks, but really are... freaks.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: It’s on full display here though, huh? (looking around) Deeply in touch with your freakiness here. My book is the reason I’m-- nevermind. (handing his CARD) How much is it?

dialogues.speaker: THE ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: $4.72, and we’re cash only.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Credit card civilization not expanded out among ye’ Natives? Pulling a SOCKET WRENCH from nelow the desk:  31 28.

dialogues.speaker: THE ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: Anything else today-- maybe a tune up..? Plucking the cash:

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: No. Can I get a receipt, please? The attendant hands over the change, Ro grabs his things, receipt, with a crazed look:

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If I keep going down this road, will it get me to the camp or not? The attendant nods.

dialogues.speaker: THE ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: Either way... I’d watch my back. I read the book about MerryMaker-- ain’t far from the truth... Roland turns, as he out the door:

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Freak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lupita spies POpPY and Anita in a heated exchange, Anita gominating the discussion. Poppy’s not happy-- Anita’s sn look catches Lupita at the window. A moment, then Poppy p in:

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: We're leaving...

dialogues.speaker: LUPITA
dialogues.text: Why does Your sister fight? She likes to hide monsters?

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: No, she’s just a fighter.

dialogues.speaker: LUPITA
dialogues.text: She’s the monster. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: No... she’s just a product of her environment.

dialogues.speaker: LUPITA
dialogues.text: I don’t know what you say. Why you stay here? Why you not run away?  32 29. Poppy smiles, pulling out Anita’s TRUCK KEYS, helping Lup gather her things, putting on her CLOTHES--

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Cause I made a promise I didn’t want to make a long time ago...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anita stands at her truck, Lupita’s CAMERA in hand. She removes the SIM CARD, tossing it into the brush, just as Poppy and Lupita pull up. Poppy points Lupita to the truck, going to retrieve the camera, just as approaching LIGHTS wobble down the narrow road:

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Who is that?

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: I don’t know, just get in the truck and get her out of here. Poppy takes the KEYS and CAMERA, climbing in the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Limbs Scrape and scratch the sides, Roland's grimace grow bigger with each screech... but as the MERRYMAKER SIGN co into view-- lit up is Anita’s surprised face. She stands at_ the gate, a showdown with headlights-- Pop and Lupita idle in her TRUCK behind her. In one motion, s grabs and aims her RIFLE, stepping slowly toward the car- quickly rolls down his window:

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Whoa, hey-- I’m unarmed, I surrender! Roland Baumgarner! I'm on the good team! Anita turns to Poppy, waving Poppy back-- Poppy flashes h lights, Anita snaps her radio from her belt:

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: low) Reverse it, take her back to the Mess hall, now please.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: (over the radio) But you just said to get her--

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: --BACK TO THE MESS HALL NOW! Wait for me there, copy?  30. Walking to Roland’s window, lowering her weapon, as Poppy backs the truck away:

dialogues.speaker: ANITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mr. Baumgarner!?

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: I’m sorry I didn’t write or call to let you know I was on my way-- but I heard you all had a camp to re- open and could use a famous face!?

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: (shocked) You’re-- here!? You actually came!?

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Well, I was in the neighborhood and thought I'd swing by... if you got room for one more? Anita shakes his hand, staring-- Roland holds it tenderly

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: Mom's letter worked!?

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Hey, I tell everyone, you're nothing without your fans.

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: I mailed it a few days ago, and post thought, you know, “No way e’d ever, he’d never"”-- (getting emotional) I just, I can’t... this is actually happening, it’s unbelievable... Roland parks, climbing out, hugging Anita tightly:

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: (in the hug) I’m so sorry for your loss-- your mother seemed like a wonderfu woman . (pulling back) Anything I can do for my fans, I’m there. They’re always numero uno. He takes a deep breath in--

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This place is beautiful! Amazing! (he qurns ) .+.--no Axe-murders to report?

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: (a smile) Not recently.  33 31.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Sorry to hear that! Well, maybe some baby-stew later then? she smirks) I'll follow you in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ZIPPO with an ARMY insignia, flicks on-- Burl wipes his bloody hands on his rag, sitting on the truck bed, gazing over the darkness that goes on forever. He sucks a drag, hacking a cough, as he lights a cigarette for Poppy...

dialogues.speaker: BURL
dialogues.text: See no evil, hear no evil--

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: --speak no evil. Thanks. Poppy sits on the truck bed, Lupita in the cab. When fina from around the bend, comes Roland with Anita leading the on Poppy’s 4X. Roland parks next to Poppy, who goes to greet him--

dialogues.speaker: POPPY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Must be somebody important-- , (extending her hand) Hi, Penelope Bishop.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Roland Baumgarner. Pleasure’s mine. She pulls him in close, quick--

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: --Roland Baumgarner? The famous writer?

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Ha. The one and only, I think.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Here-- in the flesh. My dream man.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: (taken aback) This really is quite the reception. I didn’t--

dialogues.speaker: ANITA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: --what’d I say about smoking? She snaps the cigarette away from Poppy, stomping it out:

dialogues.speaker: BURL
dialogues.text: ...only for meat?  34 32. Burl chuckles, Anita whips to him:

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: You'll respect our rules and not subject young and impressionable--

dialogues.speaker: BURL
dialogues.text: (he notices Lupita) --whoa-la, Senorita! (moving to her window) Which fence did she sneak over and muey importante, are there mucho more like eh-her comin’ for dinner?

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: (to Roland) Excuse Burl-- he’s left his manners on the cutting board.

dialogues.speaker: BURL
dialogues.text: I do forget my manners sometimes. Old habits die hard-- He ditches his cig, and pulls his large CARVING KNIFE fro behind his back:

dialogues.speaker: BURL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hope you like your Bambi dead. Burl turns away with a limp, a hitch from a bum knee.

dialogues.speaker: BURL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sloppy Doe’s inside, campers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burl holds up a pitcher, Roland takes the last sips of hi

dialogues.speaker: BURL
dialogues.text: Brewed her myself, call ‘er, Bingo Juice. Best Aperitif in 1,000 miles.

dialogues.speaker: ANI
dialogues.text: Not only iflegar, but known to numb the brain.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Then fill me up!

dialogues.speaker: BURL
dialogues.text: Bingo. Lupita sits in awe, at the end of the table, cast aside f the moment, till Poppy returns with WATER and some ADVIL. she hands it to Lupita, urging her to take it:  33.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: .-..it’s not as creepy out here as I thought it would be. Dark, quiet... it’s kinda nice, but I don’t think I could survive out here though, so exposed like this. At home, I’m oughin’ if I don’t shower twice a ay

dialogues.speaker: BURL
dialogues.text: Kinda nice though, no showers, no food-- surviving. .? Roughin’ it--

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: --I like a little roughin’.

dialogues.speaker: BURL
dialogues.text: Bingo! Roland takes another si his eyes landing on Lupita, silen and somber at the end of the table:

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: And who's Ms. Keep to Yourself and Not Say a Word, down here? Everyone turns to Lupita, no one says anything, until:

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: She's doesn’t speak good English--

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: --and unfortunately, Lucinda’s not staying much longer.

dialogues.speaker: LUPITA
dialogues.text: Me llamo is Lupita, bitch. You lie. Anita’s stung, glancing to Poppy, a look that says, “do something.”

dialogues.speaker: LUPITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...I want to leave now. Away from the monster-- Roland laughs, looking around the table, no one else is:

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Monster? What monst-- WHAAAM-- slamming against the window, screaming:

dialogues.speaker: HEEEEEELLLLLP
dialogues.text: The whole table jumps-- he bangs wildly: THE REPORTER (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: HEEEEEEEEEEEEEY
dialogues.text: 35 34. Everyone moves out quickly, except for Burl, who lights u without regard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Reporter—- in BOXERS and a muddy old SHEET he’s found His neck bruised, cut and bloodied by CLAW MARKS, MARKS u and down his legs, BITE MARKS on his arms-- Anita tries t grab him, but he’s hysterical:

dialogues.speaker: WHAT IN THE FUCKING FUCK--
dialogues.text: his voice cracking)

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: Okay now, calm down! It is not okay to--

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: What happ--

dialogues.speaker: THING DRAGGED ME THROUGH THE GOD
dialogues.text: DAMN WOODS TO IT’S SECRET LAIR AND

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: Wow--

dialogues.speaker: CAUSE SIR SQUATCH IS OUT THERE AND
dialogues.text: HE’S PISSED OFF!

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Sir Squatch!?

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Come on, man-- (to’ Roland) Don’t worry, we know this guy--

dialogues.speaker: LUPITA
dialogues.text: --I have proof on my camera... of the Squatche! Es true. {Pointing at Anita) She’s take it.

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: Oh my goodness, this is like an episode of Tales From the Crypt! (to Lupita) I gave you back your camera, Lucreta.  35.

dialogues.speaker: LUPITA
dialogues.text: --with no recordings? Where are the recordings go?

dialogues.speaker: _. ROLAND
dialogues.text: Okay, wait! Let’s everyone take a deep breathe. He looks to the reporter:

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, you can’t deny something got to this kid. (to Anita) So, what is going on exactly?

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: Our friends here are both fascinated with a supposed Bigfoot--

dialogues.speaker: THE B.F. DID THIS TO ME
dialogues.text: He turns, revealing BLOODY CLAW MARKS down his back, bite marks too:

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Jesus--

dialogues.speaker: BURL
dialogues.text: (then) We have an infirmary, I’1l get you all cleaned up--

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: --has anyone thought of calling the police?

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Closest_station is 85 miles. We have full legal jurisdiction here.

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: (calling off) Burl, we need you, please!?

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: This seems a little bit out of your jurisdiction, Rangers.

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: Oh, please. Burl will drive them both into town, a clinic and a bus stop are ‘bout 25 miles from here. (to the Reporter) You're hysterical... you could have a closed head wound, subarachnoid hemorrhaging, concussion, maybe something worse--  36.

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: --uhfufufufuh, we heard you! It’s enough--

dialogues.speaker: BURL
dialogues.text: from behind) --kiddies, kiddies, simmer down, cool it off... yer’ mind plays tricks on you way out here-- bears look like Beasts, wolf calls sound like virgin sacrifices. Hell, I'da swore I saw Fay Wray and my tate lover Mary skinny dippin’ in the lake last sunset...

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: He’s the reason you’re here.

dialogues.speaker: BURL
dialogues.text: (stepping to him) You look like you could use a smoke and a pancake, partner. Where’d you park? Anita pulls the reporter’s KEYS from her pocket, holding up for Burl. He leads him away, lighting up a_cig for the Reporter-- they disappear around the corner. Anita pivots

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: My apologies for that. He was a trespasser Penelope found. Just trying to do our best among the freaks, you know? You can take it from someone who’s lived here her whole life, there’s nothing out there--

dialogues.speaker: --THERE IS SOMETHING IN THE WOODS
dialogues.text: (to Po You know this too! Roland looks to Anita:

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Where is this infamous camera of hers?

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: In my truck.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: And she claims it holds possible proof of a Merrymaker Murderer!?  36 37.

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: No, no one has said that. She’s delusional. Out of her element.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Now we have to watch it!

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: Mr. Baumgarner, this is ridiculous. It’s over. Done with. (quickly) Penelope, inside with me. Anita pulls Poppy inside. Roland studies Lupita-- after a moment:

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: I must admit, my curiosity, it’s beyond peaked. Lupita darts, moving to KNOCK on the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KNOCK, KNOCK, KNOCK--—

dialogues.speaker: A MINUTE, PLEASE
dialogues.text: (to Poppy) --we 3 reed to this a long time ago, Penelope. You promised me.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: We didn’t agree to it with circumstances involving a maimed reporter, a delirious Mexican girl... things have changed--

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: --stop. What’s changed? Except that we're all systems go.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Something is killing people, Anita! , (then) Again! You can say you never--

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: --so run away if you want, it won’t change anything except everything.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Just remember what happens at the end of your plan--

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: --maybe someone or something will get me, hang me from a tree and ance on my bones. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: ANITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: For your sake, I hope that makes it easier for you to abandon your legacy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BEAST’S P.O.V. FIFTY FEET UP IN TREE-- It watches Roland, as Poppy bounds out of the door, Anita behind her:

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Mr. Baumgarner, we’ve set you up in Cabin Six, just between mine and Anita’s Cabins.

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: And Lupita, if you can come with me, please--

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: --wait, what about watching her--

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: --see for yourself if you'd like, but her tape is completely blank... Anita pulls Lupita with her quick, as Pop grabs onto Rola EXT. CAMPGROUNDS - ROLAND’S CABIN - NIGHT 38 Roland trails Poppy, headlights illuminating her ASS, as drives her FOUR WHEELER standing. Ro parks his CAR, Poppy hops off her CART:

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Door’s unlocked, I’1ll get your motor runnin’. Roland smiles, watching her disappear around back. He tak deep breath, coughing... BRUUUUNNGGGGGG, the GENERATOR les on, lights in CABIN SIX glow on, CABIN FIVE too, as well as two FLICKERING LAMPS illuminating the SHOWER STAT 30 yards away.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. POPPY’S CABIN - NIGHT 39 Anita stands in her door-- leaving Lupita alone with came in hand. The room is a BED and DRESSER, that’s it:

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: You captured nothing, comprendo? I looked, okay? Nothing... (moving to_ the door You stay put. Poppy will be over to drive you out when she’s done. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: ANITA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (closing the door) Goodbye, Snoopita...

dialogues.speaker: LUPITA
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roland Rie PS his bag on the bed-- Poppy in the doorway, 1 by moon She leans She moves

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: No hot water in the mornings. So if you don’t prefer ice-cold showers, I’d wash off before bed. a TRANQ RIFLE next to the door:

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Is that you offering protection?

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Only for those who might wander out into the woods alone.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: .--So, that’s what the woodsmen and women do for fun around here, Post Meridiem?

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Anita reads. Burl listens to the radio. I wait for the Ante Meridiem. (he smiles, impressed) I don’t sleep a lot.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Ironic, with a name like Poppy-— I figured you fall right to sleep. toward the door:

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Not even opiates can help you here. (she smiles) Anita’s cabin is right next door, if you need anything else--

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: --are they like, dorm showers, individually divided or community style--  42 43 44 40.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: =-every ything | is community here. It’s kinda like a prison, but without bars.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Sounds like you are pumped to be openin’ back up!

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: I just work here.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: I’m sure you do more than that. Her stare lingers on Roland, then:

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Enjoy the rest of your evening... A beat.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Save me some hot water, will ya? I can’t sleep if I get into clean sheets with a dirty body. Off Pop’s crooked smile--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anita drives slow-- suddenly in her headlights, a large figure approaches. She flashes her brights, as it draws closer... stepping u wiping his hands, lighting his smoke, is Burl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The loud HUM of the generator mixes with the SHOWER HEAD gushing on. Poppy stands outside the open SHOWER WELL-- six spigots, doors, hanging her uniform as the area fills with STEAM. bends, pulling off her panties...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burl lands at her window with a smile:

dialogues.speaker: BURL
dialogues.text: Evenin’.

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: Uh, what happened to your co-pilot?  45 46 47 41. Shooting his hand down the road--

dialogues.speaker: BURL
dialogues.text: Damn shame. Didn’t even get the chance to report anything-- took off faster than diarrhea out a baby’s butt-- don’t think you’1l ever see his face around here again.

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: I’m not as confident as you--

dialogues.speaker: BURL
dialogues.text: ~you should be. I made him an offer he couldn’t refuse. She notices the tab of blood on his fingers, smearing on CIGARETTE FILTER as he lights up:

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: ...I have a proposal for you. INT. CAMPGROUNDS - ROLAND’S CABIN - NIGHT 45 Roland sits in silence, absentmindedly, he spins his RING checks his CELL, 10% BATTERY LEFT and NO SERVICE. He scro through his RECENT CALLS, finding Christine. He dials. It doesn’t connect. He tosses the phone atop his open TOILETRY BAG... INT. POPPY’S CABIN - NIGHT 46 Lupita stares out the window, scared but curious:

dialogues.speaker: LUPITA
dialogues.text: (in s anish) That bitch isn’t coming... so go find her and tell her to get you hell outta here! Her eyes tick to a SHOTGUN propped by the door.

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: First, I wanna know something-- what draws it to the blouses? The color, texture, the scent?

dialogues.speaker: BURL
dialogues.text: Not so far along as you think, Columbo. I’m glad you called me. You need me.  49 50 51 42.

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: This thing is the only reason you're here right now. You remember that.

dialogues.speaker: BURL
dialogues.text: Impossible to forget with you around. But it ain’t a deal, till I hear you say it... You. Need. Me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steaming, hot water rains onto the arch of Poppy | s back she’s Working the shampoo into her hair. Her head cocks, ° look to the or-- no one there...

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: Those are my terms. Take it or leave it. Burl pulls out a CIGAR:

dialogues.speaker: BURL
dialogues.text: With one addendum--

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: --absolutely not.

dialogues.speaker: BURL
dialogues.text: (ignoring. her) .»-when I deliver a end, you grant me full pardon, for every past indiscretion in our past lives, here or otherwise. (smelling the cigar) We'll burn them to ashes and let the smoke carry them to heaven.

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: (steely) If you deliver. He extends his hand, greasy, some blood maybe-- Anita loo repulsed, she shakes it quick.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: EXT. CAMPGROUNDS - ROLAND’S CABIN - NIGHT 51 Roland stands in the middle of the road-- he looks back t Cabin Six, its desolate... then down the dark path in fro of him-- as if pulled by a force, he heads down the path. toward the shower station.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: 52 53 43. EXT. ANITA’S CABIN - NIGHT 52 Lupita cautiously walks in the dark, SHOTGUN aimed, camer hung around her shoulder. FROM THE BEAST P.O.V. Above the cabin, moving on the intertwining tree limbs, pacing Lupita, the BEAST tracks silently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roland inches up to the door, listening for the sound of running water. He spies the path he’s just come-- no one around... as he steps inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOAP washes down her thighs, as Poppy racks her face, her eyes pry open, and she catches something move behind the wa .

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: I saw that! She waits, but there’s no response... until stepping out, facing away, is Roland:

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I figured you’d come and gone by now.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Well... I’ve not done either yet... She reaches behind her, turning the water back on:

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Looks like there’s plenty of hot water left, I’1l come back.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Why can’t you look me in the eye and say it..? Ro furrows:

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: .«--uh, it’s just, I’m not used to such overt-- you could be one of my students.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: But I’m not.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: No, of course not, I didn’t--  54 55

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: You can teach me something, if you'd like? She steps out of the steam-- just her thin arm covering h breasts, as she reaches out with the other, to his should

dialogues.speaker: POPPY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No one can hear you. No one can see you-- but just in case... She cranks the HOT WATER, and the steam begins to billow.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: EXT. CAMPGROUNDS - ROLAND’S CABIN - NIGHT 54

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lupita’s nearly at the showers, SHOTGUN wobbling-- as the BEAST descends from its perch, CRACK! Lupita freezes-- bu all she sees is black...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poppy stands close to Roland, peering down:

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: What are you hiding down there? He’s still in his boxers:

dialogues.speaker: I--
dialogues.text: She kisses him hard-- then:

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: --relax, it’s just like going swimming if you have those on... Her hands slide down his chest, onto his boxers, pushing own:

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: --wait! Oh God... As Poppy works her magic down below-- he closes his eyes- flash of CHRISTINE, KARA:

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We hafta stop-- Poppy stops, eye to eye, with a look-- “you don’t want me  56 57 58 59 60 61 45.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: --I'm... married.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Not in this version. As she tightens her grip...

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 58
dialogues.text: EXT. CAMPGROUNDS —- SHOWER STATION - NIGHT 59 WHOOOOOOOMMMAAAAH-- the generator muffles, the lamps dim barely flickering at all-- Lupita silently approaches. Sh ducks at the window... one WHAM! Lupita is collapsed onto. DESCENDING FROM THE ROOF, she’s grabbed, the quick sound struggle-- a GNARL, grappling, wildly arms flail, it muff her SCREAMS, then her neck SNAPS. Roland climaxes in the background. The blazing moonlight reveals Lupita’s limp BODY being dragged away into the forest. The BEAST grunts-- a FLASH it’s LARGE, FURRY BODY disappearing into the dark. A HORRIFYING, ANGUISHED HOWL pierces the natural silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anita and Burl freeze, heard the howl:

dialogues.speaker: BURL
dialogues.text: Close--

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: --you have your orders, Wolf-man. She flicks the nameplate on his FATIGUE shirt; WOLF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roland shuffles back to his cabin, his BLUE EYES stunned, if they might break...  62 63 64 65 46. Poppy dashes by on her FOUR WHEELER, squawking into her RADIO, quickly she’s out of site.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: Roland closes the door behind him, turning out the lights curling up in the fetal position on the floor...

dialogues.speaker: FLASH TO
dialogues.text: INT. ROLAND’S HOUSE - BEDROOM - NIGHT 62 Christine types in bed, Pe ROL to rub her eyes. The clock reads 11:38, She glancés to Roland’s empty place, the not left untouched from the morning. She eyes her phone, no missed calls. She finds her place and begins typing again.

dialogues.speaker: WHEN THE MONSTERS EAT EACH OTHER.
dialogues.text: Her cursor moves-- “It was cold, cloudless sunrise...” FADE TO. INT. ROLAND’S CABIN - DAY 63 Roland sleeps, still fetal position, silently, until-- BA BAM-BAM on his DOOR. He startles, as bursting in:

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: (frazzled) Lupita in here with you!? She rips the covers off of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anita squats at the end of the DOCK, eyes fixed across th lake-- a predator stalking her pr ey: Perched high on a l clear across from her, staring -- the BEAST watches. It climbs higher, stretching out, revealing it’s towering long frame. It hangs from a 1imb; bellowing out a PRIMAL SCREAM. Anita jolts--

dialogues.speaker: TO
dialogues.text: EXT. ROLAND’S CABIN - DAY 65

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: (over the radio) Poppy, get over to the dock now.  66 67 47. Roland pulls on a shirt, emerging from his cabin:

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: What's going on-- Before he can finish, Poppy mounts her FOUR WHEELER, revv drowning him out.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: I’m responsible for you, so come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they bump and ride on the 4X, the pair sit back to bac

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: (over his shoulder) Um-- I’m sorry if this sounds stupid but... I didn’t mean for what happened last night-- POPPY ; --I don’t know what your talking about. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: I didn’t think-- She jerks the wheel, swerving, trying to shut him up.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: What happens here, stays here.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Right. Exactly. Okay... They turn, passing an ARROW SIGN on the side of the trail

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roland stands, Poppy’s bent down, both their faces blank. Anita stares down, at the end of the dock-- Lupita’s ripp up shorts and shirt. Anita fished out her sock, laying on ioc

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Is that what I think it is? Turning on a dime--  48.

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: This is nothing, past-- a hiccup. We get our fair share of skinny- dippers too.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: --her shorts are shredded, Anita!

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: Listen--

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: --I think your re-opening probably needs to be cancelled, don’t you agree?

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: Absolutely not!

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: This could have been me, Anita.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: She's right-- there is somethin strange going on here. What’s the true story with the reporter kid? What did that to him? Who did that to him?

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: And where is Burl!?

dialogues.speaker: EVERYONE JUST CALM DOWN, OKAY
dialogues.text: (then) Mr. Baumgarner-- I’1l make you a deal. (a breath) We won’t re-open until we figure out exactly what is out there.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: So, you! re confirming, something is out there?

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: You have nothing to be afraid of, I can confirm that.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: We don’t know what the hell we’re tracking.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Or what’s tracking you.

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: I will not, under any circumstance, confirm it’s a bigfoot. That is pure mythos and plain stupidity.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: But whatever it is, it’s big?

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: And it’s killed already.

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: So says whom? Have you seen any bodies? (they stare) | Let’s all take a minute and we'll devise a search plan, copy?

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Uh, not copy-- I’m a writer, not The Grizzly Man-- I’m not going tramping, t rough the middle of the woods alone--

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: --you won’t be alone. Roland, ou’ll come with me to the gun arn. Poppy, go get Burl. We'll rendezvous at the Mess Hall.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Excuse me-- go with you to what? Poppy climbing on her FOUR WHEELER:

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Fifteen minutes? Holding her look, a flash of concern:

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: Copy, fifteen. Be careful. Anita’s eyes flash to Roland, as Poppy revs the engine.

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Copy, careful. She peels off, leaving Ro staring:

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Something’s out here--

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: --there’s something everywhere, in one way or another. You can either stand and fight or cower and run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a RADIO playing outside, SCOTT JOPLIN’S Pineapple Ra plays. A bloody CARVING KNIFE sits on a mixing bowl full of pink water, bits of TENDONS, and MUSCLE float. Unlit cigarette dangling, Burl hollows out a BEARS PAW, in a zone, he’s f the claws to razor sharp:

dialogues.speaker: BURL
dialogues.text: I bring this life that came from God above. Offer it to protect the ones I love. If it’s needed to take life from me, count it most, Lord... with courage in victory. He strips his T-shirt off, revealing THREE SCARS, slicing across his heart. On his ARM, a faded TATTOO: Courage, Respect, Victory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poppy barrels through thick brush on the 4x, eyes” peeled the BEAST BLURS in the far distance, tracking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pair stand before a huge, gray RUSTIC BARN; the plank old wood and metal are all rusted and worn--

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: This must be the honeymoon suite? Anita pulls the double doors open, she pushes an old WAGO AXLE off of a MAT, ripping it up to find buried in the ground, a GUN LOCKER-— she opens the doors, revealing 20 DIFFERENT RIFLES, STUN GUNS, TASERS and AMMO:

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I thought you said there was nothing to be afraid of.

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: With a collection of pretty maidens like this, there isn't.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Listen, I could pretend I’m half as tough as_you guys, but I’m not really. I think it might be best if I just head out. Maybe I could come back when You guys get this stuff worked out--

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: --baby Lacenta stew. Used tampons as tea Sr severed penises soaked in alcoho -  70 71 72 51.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: --you read the book.

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: I'd have thought a writer would love something like this. A little conflict.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: I’m all for that, but only if no one gets hurt--

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: You’re not hurt, are you? I’m not hurt. Who's getting hurt? Some girl that when you drive outta here tomorrow, you won’t even remember her name? ROLAND ; I don't-- I remember her name, it’s Lu-cerna? Anita steps in close, handing him a SHOTGUN--

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: --let’s hunt together. Get your primal juices pumpin’. You'll feel ike a real man, promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poppy hops off her 4-WHEELER, walking around the back-- Burl’s RADIO playing Jazz:

dialogues.speaker: POPPY
dialogues.text: Burl!? She sees something moving in the bushes. She notices the FOOTPRINTS in the dirt below... CRACK! She turns, to scan treeline-- when, flying down from above, the BEAST collap onto her shoulders, hammering her as they crumble.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Why are we gathering guns, again? Cause my courage level is pretty--

dialogues.speaker: ANITA
dialogues.text: --cause unlike you, we can’t run ayy; We belong here... and I owe ife to this land, and to protecting it by all means.  52.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND

dialogues.text: (breath of courage, then) ...-Penguin reached out to me, and I‘ve agreed to become an Assistant Editor there, with one condition: they agreed to publish my first attempt at a novel. That’s what that is.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: What!? Honey!? Oh my God, that’s fantastic! When-- why didn’t you tell me before!?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINE
dialogues.text: Cause I only recently figured out the way to end it. Horror stories all end the same, right? You have to kill the monster.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: Babe, this is huge. I can’t wait to read it. Your first big hit!

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINE
dialogues.text: Let’s not get ahead of ourselves-—-

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: --I know I keep saying it, but... maybe this all was really a blessing in disguise. No pain, no gian, right!?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINE
dialogues.text: If you believe in that sort of thing.

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND
dialogues.text: A horror, huh? Treading on my turf. Tread lightly. (thumbing nonchalant) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: ROLAND, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What did you find to write about that was so horrifying?

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTINE
dialogues.text: ..-all the things I wish I didn’t know about you. She turns, pulling the door open, as Roland opens the fir page to DIVORCE PAPERS waiting underneath, already signed Christine. Next, print outs of the PHOTOS Kara sent on the I.M., selfies, clothing optional. He pulls the papers off, revealing her COVER PAGE below:

dialogues.speaker: ANIMAL AMONG US
dialogues.text: By Christine Clay His face falls-- Chris turns away, as he collapses back i the ROCKING CHAIR, stunned. Maybe off in the background, a thought in his head, or somewhere in between, -no one knows what it’s like to feel these feelings, like Ido...” Dead quiet. Till, in the not too far distance-- between the TREES-- SNAP! CRACK! Roland’s eyes dart, staring out to the PROPERTY LINE, whe the land meets the ‘wild. His gaze narrows on a SHAKING LIMB... a SHADOW moving out of sight. His BIG BLUE EYES s out-- a mind now a thousand miles away. Hidden within the trees, staring back at him-- long SCARS runs up the back of the fleshy thigh, a SHOTGUN by her si Anita’s BIG EYES peer through the cheap WOLF MASK... a wi smirk on her face-- --as Roland reaches for a PEN, sat_on the table next to h WATER, he stares at the signature line of the divorce pap e places them to the side, CLICKING his pen, as he opens the first page-- we... FADE OUT. THE END.
